decls.name: point
decls.comment: Stores x and y coords

decls.name: playerstate
decls.comment: stores the state of a player

decls.name: gamestate
decls.comment: stores the state of the game

decls.name: thisGameState
decls.comment: the state of this game

decls.name: waitingForRoll
decls.comment: are we waiting for someone to have a go?

decls.name: squareSize
decls.comment: size of the side of a game square

decls.name: pieceDiameter
decls.comment: diameter of playing pieces

body.text: Odd numbered rows go right to left (for 36-sqnum)

decls.name: wormholes
decls.comment: stores start and end point of each snake and ladder

decls.name: legendMargin
decls.comment: text margins for legend

decls.name: playerText
decls.comment: localised text for "Player"

decls.name: instructionText
decls.comment: instruction text spoken at the start of the game

body.text: Only (re)do translations if we haven't done them or if the language has changed

decls.name: winnerText
decls.comment: localised version of the string "WINNER!"

body.text: Displays a random die side every 0.2 sec for <seconds> seconds and then displays the number passed. Used to simulate rolling.

decls.name: instructionTextDefault
decls.comment: English version of the instruction spoken at the start.

decls.name: playerTextDefault
decls.comment: English word for player

decls.name: winnerTextDefault
decls.comment: English version of word to concatenate to winning player

decls.name: currentTranslationLanguage
decls.comment: the language of the current translation

decls.name: instructionSound
decls.comment: the text to speeched version of the instructions

decls.name: dieStyle
decls.comment: Which die style to use. 0 (default) sprites, 1 pictures, 2 unicode text

decls.name: currentPlayerNameText
decls.comment: used to store current player name so we can restore it after their turn

elseBody.text: Move the piece forward n squares

decls.name: shakeToPlay
decls.comment: use shake to roll die?
